intro: Pavetta robusta, commonly known as the robust pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Pavetta robusta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
